There seem to be issues with the expansion provided by emmet. Any ideas? Gif provided below for explanation.

data.title: Can we have a light action bar with the light theme?
data.body: I love VS Code and I think everyone knows that. I have opened many issues and stuff but one thing that I always wanted and is really starting to bother me is the dark action bar on the light theme. I mean look at this: Now if we just hide status bar and activity bar, this will be the result: Look at it, how clean and beautiful it gets when you just make it all-light. I get that most of the people use the dark theme so somehow a very small portion care about light one, but can we have a light activity bar?

data.title: Add Windows keyboard shortcut for Save All back
data.body:
Regression from 1.9, introduced with https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/14818

Someone on Twitter noticed that the keybinding Ctrl+K, S was gone. With the chords shown in the menus, it is now also easier to discover.

data.title: Issues with files.autoSave
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.1 (653f8733dd5a5c43d66d7168b4701f94d72b62e5, 2017-03-02T00:27:09.350Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.4.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-elixir|mjmcloug|0.1.1|
|Ruby|rebornix|0.10.4|
|rewrap|stkb|1.3.0|;


---

Since the 1.10.1 update, autosave works intermittently. I've tried both `onFocusChange` and `onWindowChange`. Currently, `"onWindowChange"` appears to work.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Use `"files.autoSave": "onFocusChange"`
2. Edit code, switch away from window and see it's unsaved.

data.title: Provide hinting to user that terminal links require ctrl
JSDoc Type hints not working for imported types.
data.body:
Let me know if this is actually a TypeScript bug.  While there isn't explicitly any TypeScript involved (except the typings file in the source) I recognize that a lot of the JavaScript intellisense is sourced from the TypeScript engine.

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

```javascript
var Foo = require('foo');
/** @type {Foo} */
var foo; // `foo` is of type `any` according to tooltip.
```

```javascript
var Foo = require('foo');
var foo = new Foo(); // `foo` is of type `Foo` according to tooltip.
```

```javascript
/** @type {WebGLRenderingContext} */
var foo; // `foo` is of type `WebGLRenderingContext` according to tooltip.
```

The above illustrates that while VSCode knows about and understands the imported type `Foo` (the package has a typing file).  When using JSDoc for type hinting in JavaScript, VSCode doesn't appear to recognize it in the JSDoc.  The last example shows that the JSDoc hinting is working _in general_ by providing a globally scoped/available type in the doc and seeing that VSCode does the right thing.

data.title: When using ctrl+d (addSelectionToNextFindMatch) on a repeated character, it extends selection
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 (patched up)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Write a document with repeated characters EG: AAAbbbcccA
2. Select first character of repeated sequence, hit ctrl+d
3. Note the select expands instead of singularly selecting the next character, next ctrl+d will not find a single character, but the double character version
![vscode-addselectiontonextfindmatch](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5105596/23567890/3869ec80-000d-11e7-87da-e5efd7354641.gif)

data.title: Show exception widget for promise rejection
data.body:
I set different StoppedEvent reasons for exceptions vs promise rejections, and we should show the exception widget for promise rejections too. From #21905

It seems like it's currently only shown when `reason === 'exception'`, but it should be shown either whenever the exception text is set, or when `reason === 'promise rejection'`

Nothing will happen.  It tries to open that which is already opened instead of allowing you to open it on a second screen also.

Thanks!

data.title: Disable strict SSL in ./node_modules/vscode/bin/install script?
data.body:
I'm on a corporate network (not a proxy) that imposes its own self-signed SSL certificate on outbound https traffic.

I already have this in my `settings.json`, which is insecure but at least allows me to install vscode extensions:

```
    "http.proxyStrictSSL": false
```

Likewise, I can turn off strict ssl to install npm modules, with `npm set strict-ssl false`.  This is git bash on Windows:

```
$ npm config ls -l | grep strict-ssl
strict-ssl = false
```

```
$ cat package.json
{
  "name": "test-vscode-install",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "",
  "main": "index.js",
  "engines": {
    "vscode": "^1.0.0"
  },
  "scripts": {
        "vscode:prepublish": "node ./node_modules/vscode/bin/compile",
        "compile": "node ./node_modules/vscode/bin/compile -watch -p ./",
        "postinstall": "node ./node_modules/vscode/bin/install"
  },
  "author": "",
  "license": "MIT",
  "devDependencies": {
    "typescript": "^2.2.1",
    "vscode": "^1.0.5"
  }
}
```

```
$ npm install

> test-vscode-install@1.0.0 postinstall C:\path\test-vscode-install
> node ./node_modules/vscode/bin/install

Detected VS Code engine version: ^1.0.0
Error installing vscode.d.ts: Error: self signed certificate in certificate chain
```

So, to summarize:

* :+1:  vscode settings.json is configured for insecure SSL, and can install extensions from the marketplace.
* :+1: npm is configured for insecure SSL, and can install ordinary npm packages without trouble.
* :x: The vscode "postinstall" node script is still choking on the self-signed cert.

Is there a way to fix this?  Thanks!

data.title: Minimap + Scrollbar (and minimap highlighting)
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Good day! It is not useful enough when you must use the functions of minimap and scrollbar at the same.
So, in my opinion, it would be very kind of you, if you add the options like:
"editor.scrollbar.vertical": false
"editor.scrollbar.horizontal": false
and possibility of hiding the highlighting of active viewport when a cursor is over on the minimap:
"editor.minimap.highlight": false

data.title: MiniMap doesn't allow to scroll correctly on the side
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Windows 7

Bug from this feature [MiniMap](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/4865)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Select long text that you have to scroll to the right to see most of it.
2. Click and hold mousse.
3. Select all and try to scroll right but with the minimap it doesn't scroll to the right.
4. After the minimap, you just go to the end of the line.

![issue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4070713/23564759/3548eeb4-0019-11e7-8980-15bce365befc.gif)

What it could be : Minimap opacity 40% and when your selecting some text and your mouse have no interaction on it when you're selecting ?

data.title: March Iteration Plan
data.body:
This plan captures the focus of our work during the March iteration. It's a 5 week iteration. We will ship **early April**.

## Endgame
- *March, 27th*: Code freeze for the endgame
- *March 31st*: Endgame done

The endgame details for this iteration are tracked in #23276.


## Plan Items

Below is a summary of the top level plan items.

Legend for annotations:

| Mark  | Description |
| ------------- | ------------- |
| :runner: | work in progress  |
| :hand: | blocked task |
| :muscle: | stretch goal for this iteration  |
| :large_blue_circle: | more details required |
| :red_circle: | missing issue reference |


### Workbench
- [x] Initial investigation into multi-root, multi-folder workspaces #396 @bpasero @Tyriar
- [x] Additional theming options in the workbench #3112 @aeschli @bpasero
- [x] Search speed improvements #19983 @roblourens
- [x] Polish - Affordance to maximize Panel #22135 @isidorn
- [x] UI - Investigate on improve key binding customization support #18095 @sandy081 @alexandrudima
- [x] UI - support to keep files deleted on disk open in the editor @bpasero

##### Tasks
  - [x] Support contributing problem matchers #22066 @dbaeumer
  - [x] Define TaskProvider API #22069 @dbaeumer 

### Editor
- [x] Move keybinding dispatching off e.keyCode @alexandrudima  #17521
- [x] Polish mini map support [(see query)](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=label%3Aeditor-minimap%20milestone%3A%22March%202017%22%20) @alexandrudima
- [x] Polish drag & drop support (clean up event ordering) #22094 @rebornix
- [x] Polish rich text copy/paste #22095 @rebornix
- [x] Investigate offline spell checking #20266 @rebornix
- [x] Improve auto completion with fuzzy matching #22153 @jrieken


### Terminal
- [x] Terminal improvements to support tasks @Tyriar
   - [x] link validation #21226 @Tyriar
   - [x] argument parsing for commands #19078 @Tyriar
- [x] Revisit: Terminal settings as workspace settings #19758 @Tyriar
- [x] UI - navigate to links on modifier click only #21506 @Tyriar


### Languages

##### Languages UI
- [x] Suggestions in comments - revisit and reopen #9504 and leverage new token types in API @jrieken

##### TypeScript/JavaScript
- [x] Support Implementors Code Lens #20832 @mjbvz
- [x] Adopt cancellation support #18053 @mjbvz
- [x] Investigate performance issues reported for TS Server #22102 @mjbvz
- [x] Track TS server extension API #22101 @mjbvz

##### Markdown
- [x] Explore extension mechanisms for the buiilt-in markdown support #22916 @mjbvz

### Debugging
- [x] Support async stack frames  #5552 @roblourens @weinand
- [x]  Show all source code when debugging against a remote process #20355 https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-chrome-debug-core/issues/182 @weinand @roblourens
- [x] Surface new Exception DAP in UI #22078 @weinand @michelkaporin 
- [x] Support a server mode for debug adapters #22080 @weinand
- [x] Debt: Support env variables for extension host debugging #22150 @weinand
- [x] Debt: Reliable inline instruction pointer (e.g. multi threaded programs) #21122 @weinand @isidorn
- [x] Explore: Add debug menu to improve discoverability #22077 @isidorn
- [x] Explore: configuration UI (quick pick) for exceptions #18093 @weinand
- [ ]  :runner: Experiment: support Live Edit for node-debug (legacy protocol) #6930 @weinand
- [x] Edit breakpoint conditions with multiple breakpoint on same line #21151 @isidorn


### Extension Authoring
- [x] SCM - finish API based on feedback from early adapters #15894 @joaomoreno
- [x] SCM - make the git SCM Provider the default git support #22131 @joaomoreno
- [x] Support large extension, adopt new marketplace support #18146 @joaomoreno
- [x] Expose progress API #18066 @jrieken
- [x] Control script execution in HTML preview #22103 @mjbvz
- [x] Investigate more types for CompletionItemKind enum #2628 @jrieken
- [x] Add support for a ContentProvider (only interested in content, not a Document) #15723 @jrieken


### Contributions to Extensions
- [x] TSLint: investigate into running tslint as a TS server extension Microsoft/vscode-tslint#171 @egamma
- [x] Docker - add telemetry @chrisdias
- [x] Go - https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-go/issues/837 @ramya-rao-a
- [ ] :runner: PHP - language server contributions https://github.com/felixfbecker/php-language-server/issues/323 @mousetraps
- [ ] :runner: PHP - continued progress on PHP parser https://github.com/Microsoft/tolerant-php-parser/milestone/2 @mousetraps


### Engineering Items
- [x] Assess Electron adoption @bpasero
   - [x] Understand impact of Electron update on keycodes @alexandrudima
- [ ] :runner: Investigate into proxy issues #22214 @joaomoreno
- [x] extension host error spamming the core #22804 @kieferrm

##### Startup performance
- [x] Support that users can capture and report an execution profile on slow startup #21631 @jrieken

##### Translations
- [x] Import/export to xliff #22092 @michelkaporin
- [x] Explore doing translations using transifex #22070 @dbaeumer @michelkaporin

##### Telemetry
- [x] Finish migration of backend @ramya-rao-a
- [x] Prune error telemetry @ramya-rao-a

##### Documentation
- [x] New TOC on website @waderyan @gregvanl 
- [x] Update vscode-samples @chrisdias @kieferrm

----

### Deferred
- Editor architectural documentation @rebornix @alexandrudima
- UI - explore improved notification story #22388 @stevencl @chrisdias
- Debug - Support to copy the entire text of the debug console #2163 @isidorn
- Tasks - Support that an extension defines the 'Build' command #22067 @dbaeumer
- Tasks - Enable link detection for common error messages #21928 @dbaeumer
- Investigate into UI extension API, improve HTML preview #22068 @jrieken
- HTML - format on paste support #21218 @aeschli
- HTML - tag completion #2246 @aeschli
- Investigate improve release notes for Insiders #22051 @joaomoreno @gregvanl

---

- Move lines up/down with auto indent #22093 @rebornix
- Explore emmet 2.0 support #21943 @ramya-rao-a
- Separate 'configuration' from 'learning' quick links #22097 @chrmarti
- Investigate to provide guidance for technology stacks #22098 @chrmarti @chrisdias
- Enable Electron Crash reporter for all processes after Electron update #21944 @ramya-rao-a 
- Support migrating from 0.1.0 to 2.0.0 #22065 @dbaeumer

data.title: Navigate-back does not work for "Go to definition" < 5 lines
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.0-insider
- OS Version: Linux Mint 18

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Make a new file:
```ts
function a() {
}

a();
```

2. Move cursor to `a()`. Hit `F12` to go-to-definition.
3. Hit Alt-Left to go back.
4.
  - VSCode 1.10.1: Goes to the line *after* `a();`.
  - VSCode insiders: Does nothing.

data.title: Infinite loop of "The TypeScript language service died unexpectedly" (2)
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.11.0-insider (also happens in `1.10.1`)
- OS Version: Linux Mint 18

This is essentially the same as #9215.
I am able to work normally using `"typescript.tsdk": "/home/andy/.nvm/versions/node/v7.7.1/lib/node_modules/typescript/lib"`, but when I try using vscode's built-in typescript compiler I get errors.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Navigate to an empty directory.
2. `code-insiders .`
3. Create a new file `a.ts`.
4. In addition to a warning `Version mismatch! global tsc (2.3.0-dev.20170303) != VS Code's language service (2.2.1). Inconsistent compile errors might occur`, I repeatedly get an error `The TypeScript language service died unexpectedly 5 times in the last 5 Minutes.`.

data.title: Add Rename File option to the context menu of file tabs
data.body:
I'd like a "Rename File" option to appear on the right-click context menu of file tabs. Ideally this would trigger a corresponding command (see #21918).

Purpose is to provide a more accessible option than the alternative of opening the explorer sidebar and right-clicking the file to rename.

data.title: Clicking and dragging in the minimap should cause it to scroll the editor.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.1 (653f8733dd5a5c43d66d7168b4701f94d72b62e5, 2017-03-02T00:33:15.706Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.4.0|
|vs-code-xml-format|fabianlauer|0.1.4|
|vscode-auto-open-markdown-preview|hnw|0.0.3|
|docomment|k--kato|0.0.14|
|Go|lukehoban|0.6.49|
|vscode-todo-parser|minhthai|1.8.7|
|vscode-elixir|mjmcloug|0.1.1|
|prettify-json|mohsen1|0.0.3|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.7.0|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.9.0|
|RustyCode|saviorisdead|0.19.1|
|vscode-wakatime|WakaTime|1.1.3|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Enable the minimap.
2. Open a file large enough to need scolling.
3. Click inside the minimap outside of the region currently visible in the editor (i.e., something you need to scroll to see). Without releasing your click, move your cursor up and down.

The click moves the editor to the region clicked but I'd expect further cursor movements before releasing the click to cause the selected region in the minimap to scroll with your cursor. That is, I'd expect it to behave the same as when you initially click the currently visible editor region in the minimap and move your cursor - how the editor scrolls with you.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.1 (653f8733dd5a5c43d66d7168b4701f94d72b62e5, 2017-03-02T00:27:09.350Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions: Ran with --disable-extensions

---

Given the following code:

```php
<?php

$foo = in_array($bar, [1, 2, 3]);

$foo = in_array($bar, ['1', '2', '3']);
```

The commas in the inline array confuse the hint popup with which parameter you're currently in.
![bad commas](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13033095/23561107/c5cb4390-0034-11e7-9eff-bab156afa595.gif)

With strings, the hint disappears entirely.
![hint disappears](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13033095/23561116/cb5ab854-0034-11e7-8909-65009e57e8a4.gif)

I've tested in a .js file and it seems to handle it fine, so I believe this is limited to PHP.

data.title: Opening internal module results in error
data.body:
Insiders:

- start node debugging session
- stop somewhere
- in CALL STACK view select internal module, e.g. 'module.js'

Observe:
![2017-03-03_18-14-00](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/23561168/64bb96b4-003d-11e7-91d6-7f774f124596.png)

data.title: Update not working
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.1 (f9d0c687ff2ea7aabd85fb9a43129117c0ecf519, 2017-02-08T23:31:51.320Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.1.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.5.5|
|python|tht13|0.2.3|
|erlang-otp|yuce|0.2.1|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Click "update" when shown.
2. Nothing happens.

1. Click "read notes".
2. Cannot read property of null.

data.title: Warning when restarting Code with active terminal sessions
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Write some code (e.g.a webserver in Go)
2. Open bash terminal and run it from the terminal
3. Maybe have half a dozen other instances open
4. Wait for a VS Code release
5. Agree to restart VS Code
6. Wait for the warning that you have active processes before closing the bash sessions...
7. swear when you realise that you inadvertantly restarted something that you were testing ...
